data.title: Oregon State Beavers at UCLA Bruins Game Thread & How To Watch
data.meta_description: The Oregon State Beavers visit Pauley Pavilion this afternoon. If UCLA loses again, they will have the worst conference record of any Bruin team since Steve Lavin's final season.
data.text:
Regardless of what happens today, UCLA will finish the regular season in an unprecedented 10th place in the Pac-12 Conference. UCLA's previous worst place in the conference standings was seventh in Ben Howland's first season.

If the Bruins should lose, they will finish with their worst conference record since Steve Lavin's final season. Those are some pretty dismal facts.

Certainly, they would seem to merit the dismissal of third-year coach Steve Alford. But, of course, Alford's fate won't be known until after the Pac-12 Tournament which is next weekend.

If you're heading to the game, let's see if we can start a Fire Alford chant with about five minutes left in the game.

Of course, being the final home game, it's Senior Day. So, Tony Parker, the only senior on this year's team, will be honored in pre-game ceremony. So, let's all be sure to give Tony a hand for sticking it out for all four years when he could have easily joined Zach LaVine and Kyle Anderson and left school early.

How To Watch, Listen, and Stream:

Game Date/Time:

Saturday, March 5, 2016, 3:30 pm PT

Location:

Pauley Pavilion, Los Angeles, CA

Game Notes:

Oregon State

UCLA

TV:

Pac-12 Networks (National, Los Angeles, and Oregon) with J.B. Long and Matt Muehlebach

Online:

Pac-12.com and the Pac-12 Now app

Radio/Audio:

570 AM in Los Angeles with Bill Roth and Darrick Martin

Sirius Ch. 137 and XM Ch. 197 (UCLA Call)

And, of course, right here in the Bruins Nation Game Thread!!!

This is your Oregon State at UCLA State Game Thread.

Go Bruins!!!
